title: Forget birthstones—picking gems based on your dosha is way more personal
author: Erin Magner
description: In the ancient Indian medical tradition of Ayurveda, healing crystals and stones are used to balance the doshas. Here's how to find the right one for you.
cleaned_text: Forget Birthstones—Picking Gems Based on Your Dosha Is Way More Personal [Ayurveda](https://www.wellandgood.com/jasmine-hemsley-ayurveda-lifestyle/)—a 5,000-year-old holistic healing tradition that originated in India—it's a different story. At least, that's the case when it comes to jewelry, which is believed to be a potent tool for keeping your mind and bod aligned. Here's the deal: Per Ayurveda, everyone has a certain mind-body constitution, made up of a combination of three [doshas](https://www.wellandgood.com/whats-my-dosha-ayurveda-quiz/). Your dominant dosha reflects everything from your sleep patterns to your skin health to your stress response. If you're generally healthy, it's a sign that your doshas are balanced. But if you're dealing with health issues? Well, that's a sign that your energy skews too far in one direction—airy Vata, fiery Pitta, or earthy Kapha. To help people keep their doshas in check, Ayurvedic practitioners often turn to food, herbs, and lifestyle interventions. But gemstones, too, are believed to have an impact on one's constitution, says stylist-turned-shaman Colleen McCann. "Vedic astrology and its sister science, Ayurveda, recommend certain gemstones to help balance the doshas," explains McCann, founder of [Style Rituals](https://www.stylerituals.com/) and author of [Crystal Rx: Daily Rituals for Cultivating Calm, Achieving Your Goals, and Rocking Your Inner Gem Boss](https://clicks.trx-hub.com/xid/leafgroup_ca5e0_wellgood?q=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB075CFRFV3%2Fref%3Ddp-kindle-redirect%3F_encoding%3DUTF8%26amp%253Bbtkr%3D1%26tag%3D%26asc_refurl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwww.wellandgood.com%252Fhealing-crystals-and-stones-ayurveda%252F%26asc_source%3Ddirect%26asc_campaign%3Dno-campaign&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wellandgood.com%2Fhealing-crystals-and-stones-ayurveda%2F&event_type=click). "According to the ancient [system], some gemstones are more healing for certain constitutional types—Pitta, Vata, or Kapha—than others." If you're a Vata, says McCann, your most energetically aligned stones include aquamarine, ruby, garnet, yellow sapphire, emerald, topaz, and onyx. Emerald and aquamarine are also harmonious stones for Pitta types, as are amethyst, blue sapphire, pearl, diamonds, moonstone, and opal. And Kaphas should seek out ruby, garnet, blue sapphire, or cat's eye, McCann says. "According to the ancient science, some gemstones are more healing for certain constitutional types—Pitta, Vata, or Kapha—than others."—Colleen McCann But that's only the beginning. According to McCann, if you work with a Vedic astrologer, Ayurvedic practitioner, or crystal healer, they can "prescribe" you a specific piece of jewelry (down to the metal) and place to wear it. "The right side of the body is our divine masculine side, so if a person feels tired and wants to increase their energy and vitality, they would wear ruby or garnet on their left hand or wrist," McCann explains. (Makes sense, given that red stones are the color of fire.) She goes on to say that the left side of the body is the receptive, divine feminine side. So if you want to work on your listening skills, you could wear a cool blue stone, like lapis lazuli, on your left hand or wrist. Even the finger you wear a ring on is said to matter, as Vedic astrology connects each finger with a certain planet's energy. Wearing gemstones on those specific fingers is said to amplify that energy. McCann says the Jupiter (pointer) finger represents leadership and expansion; the Saturn (middle) finger equals responsibility and morality; the Sun (ring) finger is linked with creativity and affection; the Mercury (pinky) finger is tied to communication and intelligence; and the Mars finger (thumb) amplifies willpower. "If you really want to get into the practice, the stone should also be worn on specific days of the week and in certain phases of the moon," the shaman adds. (Again, this is something a practitioner would advise you on, based on your constitution and astrology chart.) But that's advanced jewelry styling. For 101-level technique, just focus on finding a stone you love. "In my personal work with clients, the most important thing is working with the crystal or gemstone that carries the right vibration for you," she says. Because a sparkly something-something that makes your heart beat faster is always going to make you feel better when you look at it, no?
